chapter: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: A veterinarian with fever, chills, and myalgia is diagnosed with Q fever. Which of thefollowing is the most common reservoir of this disease?
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following is not transmitted by hard ticks?
questions.explanation: Relapsing fever is not transmitted by hard ticks, but by soft ticks.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Peripheral smear of a patient with high grade fever, arthralgia, and myalgia is given below.Which of the following transmits this disease?638
questions.explanation: The given clinical scenario with peripheral smear showing maltese cross appearance is suggestiveof babesiosis. It is transmitted by ticks.647
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: A patient with fever and joint pain presented with the following lesion on his left leg. Whichof the following transmits this disease?
questions.explanation: The given clinical scenario along with the image showing bulls eye rash is suggestive of Lymedisease. It is transmitted by Ixodes tick.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following is not true about the vector in the given image?
questions.explanation: The given image is of a soft tick. It can withstand starvation for over a year.The head of the soft tick lies ventrally and it does not have a scutum. It serves as a reservoir for Qfever and transmits relapsing fever.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following is false about the vector in the given image?640

options.C: Its nymphal stage has seven stages
options.D: It lays hundreds of eggs at once

questions.explanation: The given image is of a hard tick. The hard tick has only one nymphal stage.It has a hard chitinous shield called the scutum which covers the entire back in males a smallportion in the front in females. It feeds night and day and cannot withstand starvation. It laysseveral hundreds or thousands of eggs in one sitting.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following are also known as chiggers?
questions.explanation: Larval forms of trombiculid mites are also known as chiggers.They are spider-like arthropods which are vectors for scrub typhus. The image given below showstrombiculid mite.648
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following diseases is transmitted by the vector shown in the image given below?641
questions.explanation: The given image is of a reduviid bug. It transmits American trypanosomiasis, also knownas Chagas disease.Reduviid bug is also known as the kissing bug or triatomine bug. It lives in cracks, fissures andother spaces in the walls and ceilings of human dwellings. Residual spraying with HCH or dieldrinis used for the control of these bugs.Option B: African trypanosomiasis (sleeping sickness) is transmitted by the tsetse fly.Option C: Onchocerciasis is transmitted by the blackfly (Simulium).Option D: Visceral leishmaniasis (kala-azar) is transmitted by the sandfly.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: A 10-year-old boy presents with complaints of nocturnal pruritus. Examination showsburrows over the skin of his hands. KOH mount prepared from these lesions is given below.Which of the following vectors transmits this disease?
questions.explanation: The given clinical scenario and KOH mount showing the itch mite are suggestive of scabies. It istransmitted by itch mite or Sarcoptes scabiei.The female parasite burrows into the epidermis where it breeds. It is a small parasite, barelyvisible to the naked eye, with 4 pairs of legs.Its life cycle consists of four stages-egg, larva, nymph, and adult stages. Its spread can bethrough close contact or contaminated clothes.Benzyl benzoate is very effective as a sarcopticide. HCH, tetmosol, and sulphur ointments are alsoused.The image given below shows itch mite.0.1 mm649
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following diseases is not transmitted by mites?
questions.explanation: Kyasanur forest disease is not transmitted by mites. It is a viral hemorrhagic fever transmitted byhard ticks.Scabies, scrub typhus, and rickettsial pox are transmitted by mites.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: You are given the following slide during your community medicine practicals. Which of thefollowing diseases is not transmitted by this vector?
questions.explanation: The above image is of a head louse. It does not transmit endemic typhus which is transmitted byfleas.Lice transmit epidemic typhus, relapsing fever, and trench fever.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following diseases is transmitted by lice?
questions.explanation: Epidemic typhus is transmitted by lice and caused by Rickettsia prowazekii.Murine typhus is transmitted by the rat flea. Tick typhus is transmitted by a hard tick. Scrubtyphus is transmitted by trombiculid mite.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following is not transmitted by lice?
questions.explanation: Q fever is not transmitted by lice. It is spread by the inhalation of contaminated aerosolscontaining Coxiella burnetti.Soft ticks are the most common reservoirs of Q fever. The aerosols arise from the placenta orparturient fluids of infected livestock or from contaminated secretions on the surface of newbornanimals.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Identify the following vector which transmits murine typhus.
questions.explanation: The given image is of a rat flea-Xenopsylla cheopis. It transmits murine typhus.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following diseases is not transmitted by rat fleas?
questions.explanation: Pneumonic plague is not transmitted by rat fleas. It is transmitted by inhalation of aerosolizeddroplets.Rat fleas are vectors for murine or endemic typhus, bubonic plague, and hymenolepiasis causedby Hymenolepis nana and Hymenolepis diminuta.650
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: A flea survey is being conducted in an area prone to outbreaks of plague. Which of thefollowing indices is not used for this purpose?
questions.explanation: Incidence of plague is not an index used in flea surveys. Flea indices that are used in flea surveysare:• General flea index•Specific flea index• Percentage incidence of flea species•• Rodent infestation rate
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following is true about sand fleas?
questions.explanation: Sand fleas cause ulcers in the feet.They are also called jigger or chigoe fleas. The species called Tunga penetrans is of particularimportance as it causes tungiasis.The fertilized female burrows into the skin of the feet, often beneath the nail and causes ulcers.Tetanus and gas gangrene frequently occur because of secondary infection.They flourish best in sandy soil and are found in the western parts of India.The below image shows a sand flea.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following is transmitted by the vector shown in the image given below?645
questions.explanation: 651The given image is of a cyclops or water flea. It is the vector for guinea worm disease ordracunculiasis and fish tapeworm infection.Humans are infected with these diseases by drinking water that contains cyclops. Its average lifespan is 3 months.Physical methods like straining and boiling of water can ensure the killing of thisorganism. Chemicals that can be used to control cyclops are chlorine, lime, and abate. Biologicalmethods include Gambusia fish and barbel fish.
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites

questions.question: Which of the following diseases is not associated with rodents?
questions.explanation: Ascariasis is not associated with rodents.Diseases related to rodents are:• Bacterial -•Plague•• Tularemia• Salmonellosis•• Leptospirosis• Rat-bite fever•• Viral -• Lassa fever• Encephalitis•Hemorrhagic fever• Rickettsial -• Scrub typhus• Endemic typhus• Rickettsial pox• Parasitic -• Hymenolepis diminuta• Leishmaniasis• Amoebiasis• Trichinosis••Chagas disease• Fungal -• Histoplasmosis•Ringworm652653
questions.chapter_heading: Medical Entomology - Ticks, Fleas and Mites
